content: Has the number of people living in extreme poverty increased, decreased, or stayed the same over the last several decades?

Over the last several decades, the number of people living in extreme poverty has decreased significantly. According to the World Bank, extreme poverty is defined as living on less than $1.90 a day. In 1990, about 36% of the world's population lived in extreme poverty, which has dropped to around 8.6% in 2018. This represents a substantial reduction in the number of people living in extreme poverty, although there is still much work to be done to eradicate poverty entirely.
